intro: Sida rosula, commonly known as the smallleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with hairy, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Sida rosula is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in warm, dry environments.
